title: James Grayson lands late penalty as Northampton stun champions Saracens in Premiership opener at Allianz Park
text:
Saracens 25 Northampton Saints 27

Chris Boyd was full of praise for young James Grayson after the fly-half remained ice cool to ensure Saints celebrated their first victory at Allianz Park for three-and a-half years.

Northampton director of rugby Boyd feared his men had blown the chance of a rare success against the Premiership champions in their opening fixture of a new campaign when seeing a six-point lead overturned in the second half.

But referee Ian Tempest upset the home fans by awarding a penalty against the hosts with 90 seconds left, and Grayson, 21, the son of former England No 10 Paul, took his time before sending his kick confidently through the posts.

It gave Saints, who...
description: Chris Boyd was full of praise for young James Grayson after the fly-half remained ice cool to ensure Saints celebrated their first victory at Allianz Park for three-and a-half years.
